author: Special Correspondent
text:
It is believed to be an oldest temple in Puducherry

Renovation work under way at the Sri Varadharaja Perumal temple. — Photo: T. Singaravelou

The Maha Samprokshanam (consecration) of the renovated Sri Perundevi Thayar Samedha Sri Varadharaja Perumal temple will be held on January 20 in a grand manner. Hundreds of devotees are expected to offer prayers to the deities on the occasion.

Raj Bhavan constituency MLA K.Lakshminarayanan said, “The renovation works had commenced three years ago at an estimated cost of Rs.5 crore.

Now almost all works have been completed and ready for the consecration scheduled to be held on January 20.”

The Dravidian style ancient temple is located in Puducherry and is believed to be the one of the oldest temples in the Union Territory. The temple is under the purview of Hindu Religious Department.

The badly damaged walls of the temple and corridors had been reconstructed.

The Rajagopuram, had also been renovated with due care. A few “mandapams” and the temple tank were renovated and shrubs removed. Existing Cuddapah stones were replaced with granite slabs while brass was segmented in wooden doors.

Temple administrators said instructions have been given to the workers to complete the renovation works as quickly as possible. Hundreds of devotees are expected to participate in different parts of the region.

The yagasala for the consecration will begin on Thursday.

Chief Minister N.Rangasamy and other ministers are expected to participate in the consecration celebrations.
title: ‘Kumbhabhishekam’ of Perumal temple on Jan. 20
